markdown: Robert E. Shank, M.D. Page 2 April 17, 1972 As you know, each candidate selects the area of special emphasis to be covered in depth in his examinations. We are attempting to compile for each area topics or rubrics within which questions may be developed. We should like to express our appreciation for your response to Dr. Harold Ellingson's request for help in this regard. The suggestions from last fall's examiners have given us an excellent start in this undertaking. We hope, too, to have a list of recommended essential readings for each area, and will appreciate receiving your suggestions for such a list. Please accept my personal thanks and those of the Board for your cooperation. <::attestation: Signature Signed Signature: legible (Bill) Sincerely, William P. Richardson, M.D. Vice Chairman, General Preventive Medicine A handwritten signature 'Bill' is placed above the typed name and title, following the salutation 'Sincerely,'.::> WPR:mjm Enclosure Source: https://www.industrydocuments.ucsf.edu/docs/ffbg0227

We are attempting to compile for each area topics or rubrics within which questions may be developed. Please accept my personal thanks and those of the Board for your cooperation.

<::attestation: Signature Signed Signature: legible (Bill) Sincerely, William P. Richardson, M.D. Vice Chairman, General Preventive Medicine A handwritten signature 'Bill' is placed above the typed name and title, following the salutation 'Sincerely,'.::>
